jurisdiction.title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Joliet Illinois

8182961BB94745B8880343C044B54E34.description:
World: Identify on a map the location of the
major world political powers, over
time, and explain how their location
fostered their growth and development.

3915982F2F434BB0BB05CE8A463A07E4.description:
United States: Describe the physical and cultural
features of life in pre colonial America
using images or examples.

62469DF484C2469AA13987EE0D84C50E.description:
Describe the effect of significant
invention or technological innovation
on the physical and cultural
environment.

2A0EC9C8B0044D4E96E0860EB59A6AD0.description:
Provide an example of how some
people continue to depend on human or
animal power to survive in their
environment.

DA3ED8F085E843CFA47E6B56F5D12B46.description:
Describe how various people used
human or animal power to cultivate
crops before the onset of mechanized
technology.

B8301F3C5EC0439A873F36C600648EEA.description:
Describe their roles and
responsibilities as stewards of God’s
creation.

03F8E59A51BE4DAA97ADF19B05F9526F.description:
Identify turning points in
environmental history.

5E00AE7DC0534D2CBD85CE1F6584B8FD.description:
Understand Illinois, United States, and world environmental history (United States). Understand how Church belief regarding creation and God’s providence shape history of United States and the world. Demonstrate a general understanding of the “story” of humanity from creation to present through a Catholic concept of the world and man.
CSGS1
Relate how history begins and ends in God and how history has a religious dimension. CSIS1
Evaluate how societies have been used to provide a sense of coherence and meaning to human life, shaping and forming human culture and
events. CSIS9 (7&8)

A665A683919A4221AB6B40AE6134B49A.description:
World: Describe how a cultural exchange
occurred between two societies of the
past.

0AB440C7C38A4DBBAE797A5BE93A9812.description:
United States: Describe the impact of the Church on
social development in the United
States.

06A4E7A5A61F4068ADA9A2DE6DC22427.description:
United States: Compare/contrast family and
community life in two or more
American colonies in terms of the
colonists’ motives for settling there.

D493C668456F4F5EAB7C3DE8B090C5D1.description:
Assess the influence that significant
people had on the social lives of others
in Illinois, the United States and/or
world.

054DE6094057467EA524704DB59B9D51.description:
Discuss how the roles of men, women,
and children in past cultures have
changed over time.

96C2C1EDE4A14600A3482B09E1B0385A.description:
Use a variety of sources to describe
how and why people organized colonial
society.

609614E03E5B40B29B594E312E1512B7.description:
Understand Illinois, United States, and world social history (United States/World). Understand social history of Church, Illinois, United States, and world. Demonstrate an understanding about great figures of history by examining their lives for examples of virtue. CSGS2
Value the significance and impact of the Catholic Church throughout history. CSDS5
Examine how one’s own life and life-choices creates a personal history with eternal consequences. CSIS3 (7& 8)
Analyze how God has revealed Himself throughout time and history, in the things we know best and can easily verify. CSIS4 (7&8)
Demonstrate how historical events and patterns of change help us predict and plan for future events CSIS12 (7&8)
Discuss thoughts and deeds of great men and women of the past. CSIS15 (7 & 8)

73F58CC8BC0341688856CD7E6E26651A.description:
World: Identify the differences between
agricultural and industrial economies.

E6463F7614E642C5B3C49D6358835113.description:
World: Describe the impact of trade on the
development of early civilizations.

0A1842E383744332BBF69DA197D9385B.description:
United States : Describe how slavery and indentured
servitude were related to the wants of
economic interest groups in the United
States.

2585564152784121969591EF826C260E.description:
United States : Describe the economic choices people
made or were forced to make during the
development of the early economy of
the United States.

513F447BA3234C23A7D4EDD5B4D3C343.description:
Tell how moral and ethical viewpoints
can shape economic decisions.

2838E1ECE80C408893372166F4C08A0D.description:
Explain how economic decisions
affected people’s political, social and
environmental lives.

7F128719140A427DAC60F51966D65C39.description:
Identify and explain important events in
economic history.

1F102880C18447C29F967F7497329F28.description:
Understand the development of economic systems (United States/World). Understand how moral or religious thought contributed to the development of economic systems. Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions. CSIS7
Discuss how history can assist man in the acquisition of values and virtues. CSIS12

4F8B061AEB8241A5A74D673B82A04B0B.description:
World: Describe major leaders and/or
developments in Western world.

69416524BAD24723AB05C9CB8F72D53D.description:
World: Identify significant political leaders of
the non-Western world (e.g., Genghis
Khan, Gandhi, Mandela).

70433A38FF6F4DA6BD4BAD627F5D8174.description:
United States: List the key figures, events, and ideas
in the development of the United States
government during the Early National
Period.

947161CDE2B543009BAABDD591BD6BB6.description:
United States: Analyze political events, figures, and
ideas in the colonies that led to the
American Revolution.

28AEA551FBB849DC83CAB1AA10099D86.description:
United States: Summarize the causes and effects of
ideas and actions of significant political
figures during the Colonial Period.

9C91FB0B36C24F13BF0349DBFB457017.description:
Analyze the consequences of political
ideas and actions taken by significant
individuals in the past.

3A9B42E8B9364106BA06B4E494DC7471.description:
Identify individuals and turning points
in Church history; tell the effects of the
events.

0D82CB65BA534DAC8E0C7FDEB43FD202.description:
Identify individuals and turning points
in political history.

78DE41BE652A478185FC8781CF0CCBDC.description:
Understand the development of significant political events (United States/World). Understand the development of significant Church or religious events. Explain the history of the Catholic Church and its impact in human events. CSIS4
Exhibit knowledge of essential dates, persons, places and facts, especially those relevant to the western traditions. CSIS5
Recognize how the central themes within the stories of important Catholic figures and saints repeat over time. CSIS6

C9F1F58C7E754858A6ABE231323D6BA0.description:
Describe how Catholic religious
practices influenced the history of the
United States.

8144B6D7029D493ABF83B9F109815106.description:
Locate on the World Wide Web one
source pertaining to who, when, where
dimensions of a research question.

31C5E1B181374C64B2EDB5D9F60382A5.description:
Identify sources in the school or local
library that will help answer a research
question.

592811DC27A74C0C856B2F9FF8AAED0E.description:
Formulate a research question about an
historical person/event.

D29383E0CD8F4CEDA10F579CA2384877.description:
Distinguish between primary and
secondary sources.

5D4806B39E374C8285E09798CF60604E.description:
Describe trends during a time period
using political, economic,
environmental, and social data from
appropriate graphs or charts.

A5325E68A44B46E3A97312198427D564.description:
Explain how life changed or stayed the
same in a region or place using two
historic maps that depict different times
in that region or place.

B1297543EAB7419F82DF695F85AF4664.description:
Apply the skills of historical analysis and interpretation. Apply the skills of historical analysis and interpretation to religious events, trends and Church individuals and movements. Relate that Jesus, as God incarnate, existed in history just like we do. CSIS2
Describe how reading history is a way we can learn about what God does for humanity. CSIS3
Explore how the moral qualities of the citizenry naturally give rise to the nature of the government and influence societal outcomes and
destinies. CSIS13 (7&8)

7761C0C1A4B34A20B53E7302AF8B7B9C.description: Understand events, trends, individuals and movements shaping the history of Illinois, the United States and other Nations. Understand religious events, trends, individuals and movements shaping the history of the United States, other Nations and the Church.
